maul.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: if an animal mauls someone, it injures them badly by tearing their flesh
maul.translation[0].definitions[0].examp: A mentally ill man was mauled after climbing into the lions’ enclosure at London Zoo.
maul.translation[0].definitions[1].defin: to strongly criticize something, especially a new book, play etc
maul.translation[0].definitions[1].examp: Her latest book was absolutely mauled by the critics.
maul.translation[0].definitions[2].defin: to touch someone in a rough sexual way which they think is unpleasant
maul.translation[0].definitions[2].examp: What makes you think you’ve got the right to maul me like that?
maul.translation[0].definitions[3].defin: to defeat someone very easily – used especially in sports reports
maul.translation[0].definitions[3].examp: Stanford have looked quite good lately. They absolutely mauled Notre Dame last weekend.
